info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne County through 630 PM EDT... At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carleton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Belleville around 545 PM EDT. Flat Rock around 550 PM EDT. Romulus and Trenton around 600 PM EDT. Taylor, Wyandotte and Greenfield Village around 605 PM EDT. Dearborn around 615 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Detroit around 620 PM EDT. Grosse Pointe around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Melvindale, Gibraltar, New Boston, Rockwood, Harper Woods, Westland, Grosse Pointe Shores, Ecorse, Grosse Pointe Woods and Woodhaven. People attending Fox Theatre, and Little Caesars Arena should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
